items.title: Government shutdown continues after Senate fails to pass spending bills

items.title: Democrats, Republicans sound off on government shutdown

items.title: US Senate rejects bid to end government shutdown, Democrats hold firm on healthcare
items.standfirst: A vote to end a US government shutdown failed Wednesday, as Democrats in the Senate held firm to the party’s demands to fund health care subsidies that President Donald Trump and Republicans refuse to provide.

items.content: US political analyst Eric Ham says the US government shutdown is a “game of chicken” that’s spiraled out of control.

ai_summary: The United States government entered a shutdown due to a lack of agreement on 2025 funding.
Up to 750,000 federal workers are facing furloughs as a result of the shutdown.
Both Republican and Democratic Senate bills to reopen the government failed on Wednesday.
The dollar declined as the shutdown began, reaching its lowest point in a week.
Financial regulators began shutting down as federal funding ran out.

clusters.title: From the archives: Naturalist Jane Goodall
clusters.neutral_headline: Jane Goodall, renowned conservationist, dies at 91

items.title: From the archives: Naturalist Jane Goodall
items.standfirst: Famed naturalist Jane Goodall, who dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and protecting the environment, died on Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025 at age 91. In this Oct. 24, 2021 "Sunday Morning" profile, she talked with Seth Doane about her fascination with animals, her groundbreaking work with primates, and her advocacy for a more sustainable future.
items.content: Famed naturalist Jane Goodall, who dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and protecting the environment, died on Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025 at age 91. In this Oct. 24, 2021 "Sunday Morning" profile, she talked with Seth Doane about her fascination with animals, her groundbreaking work with primates, and her advocacy for a more sustainable future.

items.title: Jane Goodall, pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist, dies at 91
items.standfirst: Jane Goodall, the pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist who became the world’s leading expert on chimpanzees, died on Wednesday at the age of 91, the Jane Goodall Institute said in a social media post. Born in London on April 3, 1934, Goodall produced a groundbreaking field study on chimpanzees in the wild in the 1960s and dedicated the latter part of her life to protecting their habitats.
items.content: Jane Goodall, the pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist who became the world’s leading expert on chimpanzees, died on Wednesday at the age of 91, the Jane Goodall Institute said in a social media post. Born in London on April 3, 1934, Goodall produced a groundbreaking field study on chimpanzees in the wild in the 1960s and dedicated the latter part of her life to protecting their habitats.

items.title: Jane Goodall, renowned chimpanzee researcher and animal advocate, dies at 91
items.standfirst: Dr. Jane Goodall, who will be remembered as an advocate for animals and a renowned chimpanzee researcher, died due to natural causes, the Jane Goodall Institute announced in a Wednesday statement.
items.content: Dr. Jane Goodall, who will be remembered as an advocate for animals and a renowned chimpanzee researcher, died due to natural causes, the Jane Goodall Institute announced in a Wednesday statement.

ai_summary: Jane Goodall, a famed primatologist and conservationist, died at the age of 91.
She was known for her groundbreaking research on chimpanzees and their behavior.
Goodall's institute confirmed her death, which occurred during a speaking tour.
She spent her life researching and educating others about chimpanzees and the natural world.
Goodall advocated for a more sustainable future and dedicated her life to protecting the environment.

items.title: Federal Reserve governor will keep job for now despite Trump’s bid to remove her
items.standfirst: Supreme court defers action on request to remove Lisa Cook from post, at least until it hears oral arguments on caseUS government shutdown – live updatesLisa Cook, the US Federal Reserve governor, will keep her job for now, despite Donald Trump’s extraordinary bid to remove her from the central bank’s board with immediate effect.The US supreme court deferred action on the Department of Justice’s request to allow the president to fire Cook, at least until it hears oral arguments on the case in January. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Supreme Court says Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook can stay -- for now
items.standfirst: The Supreme Court has temporarily blocked President Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, a move that critics say would have compromised the central bank's independence
items.content: The Supreme Court has temporarily blocked President Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, a move that critics say would have compromised the central bank's independence(Image credit: Drew Angerer)

ai_summary: The Supreme Court temporarily blocked Trump's attempt to fire Lisa Cook.
The court will hear arguments in January regarding Cook's removal from the Fed.
Cook will remain in her position until the Supreme Court hears the case.
Critics argue that removing Cook would compromise the central bank's independence.
The Supreme Court deferred action on the request to remove Cook.

items.title: Economists relieved as White House withdraws controversial pick to lead Bureau of Labor Statistics
items.standfirst: Donald Trump wanted EJ Antoni to head agency, but critics said he was too partisan and ‘exceedingly unqualified’US government shutdown – live updatesEconomists are expressing relief that the White House withdrew its nomination for head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the government agency that reports key economic data.In August, Donald Trump nominated EJ Antoni, chief economist at the conservative Heritage Foundation and a co-author of Project 2025, to replace Erika McEntarfer, whom Trump fired after the bureau released revisions to its monthly jobs report that showed weak job growth over the summer. Continue reading...
items.content: Donald Trump wanted EJ Antoni to head agency, but critics said he was too partisan and ‘exceedingly unqualified’US government shutdown – live updatesEconomists are expressing relief that the White House withdrew its nomination for head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the government agency that reports key economic data.In August, Donald Trump nominated EJ Antoni, chief economist at the conservative Heritage Foundation and a co-author of Project 2025, to replace Erika McEntarfer, whom Trump fired after the bureau released revisions to its monthly jobs report that showed weak job growth over the summer. ai_summary: The White House withdrew E.J. Antoni's nomination to lead the BLS.

items.title: Spotify founder Daniel Ek steps down from CEO role
items.standfirst: Ek founded Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago and will stay on as executive chairSpotify said Tuesday that founder Daniel Ek is stepping down as CEO to become the executive chair.The Stockholm-based streaming giant said Ek will be replaced by two lieutenants who will become co-CEOs: chief product and technology officer Gustav Söderström and chief business officer Alex Norström. The pair, who are also currently co-presidents, will transition into their new jobs on 1 January. Continue reading...

clusters.title: General strike against 13-hour work day brings Greece to a halt
clusters.neutral_headline: Greek General Strike Protests 13-Hour Work Day

items.title: General strike against 13-hour work day brings Greece to a halt
items.standfirst: Transport systems, hospitals and schools hit, as workers say laws kill hopes of work-life balanceA general strike has paralysed Greece as unions step up industrial action against labour laws introducing a 13-hour work day in a country that already puts in some of the longest hours in Europe.The 24-hour strike brought mass disruption to services across the country on Wednesday as thousands of workers in the public and private sector stopped work and took to the streets. Continue reading...
items.content: Transport systems, hospitals and schools hit, as workers say laws kill hopes of work-life balanceA general strike has paralysed Greece as unions step up industrial action against labour laws introducing a 13-hour work day in a country that already puts in some of the longest hours in Europe.The 24-hour strike brought mass disruption to services across the country on Wednesday as thousands of workers in the public and private sector stopped work and took to the streets. Continue reading...

items.title: Thousands of workers protest in Greece over 13-hour work day plans
items.standfirst: Thousands of Greek workers prompted large-scale disruption during a 24-hour general strike on Wednesday, protesting against the conservative government's plans to introduce a 13-hour work day. The strike has disrupted transport in the capital Athens and the second-largest city Thessaloniki, trains and ferry services, while teachers, hospital staff and civil servants are also taking part.
items.content: Thousands of Greek workers prompted large-scale disruption during a 24-hour general strike on Wednesday, protesting against the conservative government's plans to introduce a 13-hour work day. The strike has disrupted transport in the capital Athens and the second-largest city Thessaloniki, trains and ferry services, while teachers, hospital staff and civil servants are also taking part.

ai_summary: A general strike paralyzed Greece due to new labor laws.
Unions are protesting labor laws introducing a 13-hour work day.
Transport systems, hospitals, and schools were disrupted by the strike.
Thousands of workers protested the government's plans.
The strike disrupted transport in Athens and Thessaloniki.

clusters.title: Why was former DR Congo president Kabila sentenced to death?
clusters.neutral_headline: Former DR Congo President Kabila Sentenced to Death

items.title: Why was former DR Congo president Kabila sentenced to death?
items.standfirst: A military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced ex-President Joseph Kabila to death in absentia.
items.content: A military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced ex-President Joseph Kabila to death in absentia.

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
items.standfirst: Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensionsA military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes, treason and crimes against humanity.The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels supported by Rwanda in DRC’s volatile eastern provinces. Kabila, who led the country from 2001 to 2019, has denied wrongdoing and said the judiciary had been politicised. Continue reading...
items.content: Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensionsA military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes, treason and crimes against humanity.The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels supported by Rwanda in DRC’s volatile eastern provinces. Kabila, who led the country from 2001 to 2019, has denied wrongdoing and said the judiciary had been politicised. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A military court sentenced Joseph Kabila to death in absentia.
Kabila was convicted of war crimes, treason, and other offenses.
The case stems from his alleged support of M23 rebels.
Kabila led the country from 2001 to 2019.
Kabila has denied wrongdoing and called the judiciary politicized.

clusters.title: Gaza aid flotilla presses journey, accuses Israel of 'intimidation'
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza Aid Flotilla Continues Journey Despite Intimidation

items.title: Gaza aid flotilla presses journey, accuses Israel of 'intimidation'
items.standfirst: A flotilla bound for Gaza with aid for the war-battered Palestinian territory said on Wednesday that it would continue its course despite what it called "intimidation tactics" by the Israeli military. The flotilla of some 45 vessels carrying activists and politicians, including Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg and Nelson Mandela's grandson Mandla Mandela, departed Spain last month with the aim of breaking the blockade on Gaza, where the UN has said there is a famine.
items.content: A flotilla bound for Gaza with aid for the war-battered Palestinian territory said on Wednesday that it would continue its course despite what it called "intimidation tactics" by the Israeli military. The flotilla of some 45 vessels carrying activists and politicians, including Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg and Nelson Mandela's grandson Mandla Mandela, departed Spain last month with the aim of breaking the blockade on Gaza, where the UN has said there is a famine.

items.title: Pro-Palestine flotilla heading towards Gaza ‘harassed by Israeli naval boats’
items.standfirst: Account of ‘intimidatory operation’ comes as Italy and Greece repeat call for Israel to guarantee safety of flotillaA pro-Palestinian flotilla heading to Gaza has said it has been approached and harassed by Israeli naval boats that jammed one of its lead vessels’ communication systems as Italy and Greece reiterated calls for Israel to guarantee the safety of those onboard.The Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF), carrying about 500 people including the climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and former Barcelona mayor Ada Colau, said it had an encounter with Israeli navy vessels that circled the fleet’s “lead boat for around six minutes” while remotely disabling its communication systems. Continue reading...
items.content: Account of ‘intimidatory operation’ comes as Italy and Greece repeat call for Israel to guarantee safety of flotillaA pro-Palestinian flotilla heading to Gaza has said it has been approached and harassed by Israeli naval boats that jammed one of its lead vessels’ communication systems as Italy and Greece reiterated calls for Israel to guarantee the safety of those onboard.The Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF), carrying about 500 people including the climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and former Barcelona mayor Ada Colau, said it had an encounter with Israeli navy vessels that circled the fleet’s “lead boat for around six minutes” while remotely disabling its communication systems. Continue reading...

items.title: Italy to end support for international Gaza flotilla as it nears destination
items.standfirst: The Global Sumud Flotilla, with over 500 people including Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel’s blockade of GazaItaly has said it will stop tracking an international flotilla attempting to deliver aid to Gaza with a military vessel, as activists on board announced they were on “high alert” as they moved closed to their destination.The Global Sumud Flotilla, consisting of more than 40 civilian boats with over 500 people including parliamentarians, lawyers and Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel’s blockade of Gaza. Continue reading...
items.content: The Global Sumud Flotilla, with over 500 people including Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel’s blockade of GazaItaly has said it will stop tracking an international flotilla attempting to deliver aid to Gaza with a military vessel, as activists on board announced they were on “high alert” as they moved closed to their destination.The Global Sumud Flotilla, consisting of more than 40 civilian boats with over 500 people including parliamentarians, lawyers and Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel’s blockade of Gaza. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A flotilla is heading to Gaza with aid for the war-battered territory.
The flotilla accuses Israel of "intimidation tactics".
The flotilla includes activists and politicians, including Greta Thunberg.
The flotilla aims to break the blockade on Gaza.
The Israeli navy allegedly harassed the flotilla.

clusters.title: Indonesia school collapse: 91 missing and three dead as rescuers search rubble for second day
clusters.neutral_headline: School Building Collapse in Indonesia, Search Underway

items.title: Indonesia school collapse: 91 missing and three dead as rescuers search rubble for second day
items.standfirst: Desperate search for more than 90 missing after building collapses while students held prayers at school in SidoarjoParents and rescuers in Indonesia were desperately searching for dozens of teenage boys believed to be trapped, a day after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school which has already left three dead, authorities said.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing after the Al Khoziny school building collapsed while pupils held late afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...
items.content: Desperate search for more than 90 missing after building collapses while students held prayers at school in SidoarjoParents and rescuers in Indonesia were desperately searching for dozens of teenage boys believed to be trapped, a day after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school which has already left three dead, authorities said.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing after the Al Khoziny school building collapsed while pupils held late afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...

items.title: Urgent search underway for students after deadly school building collapse
items.standfirst:
In southeast Indonesia, a top floor of a building collapsed during construction while
students were gathered for afternoon prayer. Rescuers are now trying to save dozens of students caught beneath the rubble. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez has the story.

items.title: Indonesia school collapse: three dead and over 90 missing as rescue effort continues

Continue reading...
